titlestmt.titleproper: Union League of Philadelphia general managers' files 1930-2008
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012

did.unittitle: Union League of Philadelphia general managers' files

bioghist.p: The Union League of Philadelphia was founded in 1862 as a patriotic society to support the policies of President Abraham Lincoln. It evolved to its current identity as a non-sectarian and non-partisan private club.

scopecontent.p: The collection consists of records relating to the operation of the Union League under a number of general managers. The records document building maintenance and operations, events, member relations, hiring and personnel, and League committees. The collection also includes correspondence and applicant logbooks from the League's War Veterans' Committee.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

otherfindaid.p: An inventory is available in the repository.
